subject: Will AI Replace Digital Marketers?
bodyPreview:
Plus, how you can use AI to change the game
View in browser



Will AI Replace Digital Marketers?

The Three Hard Truths Every Affiliate Needs To Know



It's 2025, and it seems there's some generative AI or Large Language Model (LLM) everywher

body.content: Plus, how you can use AI to change the game View in browser Will AI Replace Digital Marketers? The Three Hard Truths Every Affiliate Needs To Know It's 2025, and it seems there's some generative AI or Large Language Model (LLM) everywhere you look. ChatGPT, DeepSeek, Jasper, you name itThese tools seem to be just as good (or at least quicker) at writing and creating images as humans, and marketers are starting to take notice. Given all of its strengths, it's only natural to start wondering how the rise of AI will affect the future of digital marketing. Will it replace digital marketers entirely, or is there some silver lining to the robot revolution? By clicking below, figure out exactly what it means for the future of digital marketers (AND your affiliate career). Read Full Article Here The Latest News On Affiliate Marketing and AI AI & Affiliate Marketing: A Match Made in Heaven How can you properly use AI to change how you do affiliate marketing forever? Get the answer from The Affiliate Marketing Dude. Watch Here The Game-Changing New AI Tool For Affiliates: Ember AI This brand-new AI tool is designed specifically for affiliate marketers. Harness the power of Ember AI and break through the competition! Read More ClickBank, 1444 S Entertainment Ave Suite 410, Boise, Idaho 83709 Unsubscribe Manage preferences

Explore learning resources and try Azure OpenAI Service.

body.content: Explore learning resources and try Azure OpenAI Service. View as a webpage Transform your applications with generative AI Many organizations are looking for innovative ways to use generative AI to gain a competitive edge. Take advantage of your Azure account to find the best AI solution for your organization. Get started with Azure OpenAI Service to tap into the full potential of language and image models including GPT-4o and DALLE. Seamless integration allows you to apply AI to a variety of business needs, such as generating realistic images and videos and enhancing customer experiences with AI-generated bots. Get started Learn how to build generative AI applications Get the skills you need to build innovative, market-ready, responsible generative AI applications in Azure AI Foundry. Start learning Drive business growth with Azure AI services Develop AI solutions with Azure OpenAI Service Automate creative processes to generate content and images. Build and deploy chat applications Empower employees with chatbots and virtual assistants. Run advanced AI models on your data Ground your data for greater accuracy and insights. Accelerate app development with prebuilt models Find the right model to build your custom AI solution. Manage Azure resources from your mobile device Azure portal Documentation Training Support Account information Subscription ID: e23aea56-f82c-4242-a329-987c1db19587 This email was sent from an unmonitored inbox. subject: Action required: Migrate to Azure Machine Learning SDK version 2 before 30 June 2026
bodyPreview:
Azure Machine Learning SDK version 1 will no longer be supported.

Migrate to Azure Machine Learning SDK version 2 before 30 June 2026

You're receiving this notification because you're associated with one or more Azure subscriptions that use Azure Ma

body.content: Azure Machine Learning SDK version 1 will no longer be supported. Migrate to Azure Machine Learning SDK version 2 before 30 June 2026 You're receiving this notification because you're associated with one or more Azure subscriptions that use Azure Machine Learning SDK version 1. Starting on 30 June 2026 , Azure Machine Learning Software Development Kit version 1 (SDK v1) will no longer be supported. To avoid service disruptions, you'll need to migrate to Azure Machine Learning Software Development Kit version 2 (SDK v2) before that date. Azure Machine Learning SDK v2 offers new and improved features to accelerate machine learning production lifecycles, including managed inferencing, reusable pipeline components, and improved pipeline scheduling. We encourage you to migrate to SDK v2 before the end-of-support date to take advantage of the added benefits. In some cases, the command syntax of SDK v2 differs significantly from SDK v1. You can learn more about the differences in our documentation . Required action To avoid service disruptions, migrate to Azure Machine Learning SDK v2 before 30 June 2026. Help and support If you have questions, get answers from community experts in Microsoft Q&A . If you have a support plan and need technical help, open the Azure portal and select the question mark icon at the top of the page. Learn more about service retirements that may impact your resources in the Azure Retirement Workbook . Please note that retirements may not be visible in the workbook for up to two weeks after being announced. Account Information Subscription ID: e23aea56-f82c-4242-a329-987c1db19587 Subscription name: Azure subscription 1 Please help us improve our communication by telling us what you think about this email in a survey . This message from Microsoft is an important part of a program, service, or product that you or your company purchased or participates in. Microsoft respects your privacy. Please read our Privacy Statement . This is a mandatory service communication. To set your contact preferences for other communications, visit the Promotional Communications Manager . Microsoft Corporation, One Microsoft Way, Redmond, WA 98052

subject: Here’s how to read your Azure bill
bodyPreview:
Understand your Azure bill with this five-minute tutorial.
͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌   ͏ ‌

body.content: Understand your Azure bill with this five-minute tutorial. View as a webpage Learn about your Azure bill Your Azure consumption is billed monthly, at pay-as-you-go pricing rates. Your bill will be sent on the ninth day of each month for charges incurred in the prior calendar month. Understand your bill and how to verify the charges in this five-minute tutorial. Youll learn how to review your bill and compare invoiced charges to your daily Azure usage. Take the tutorial Learn more about Azure billing: See how to manage billing and monitor and control spending with Azure Cost Management and Billing tools. Understand the terms and descriptions on your monthly invoice. Estimate costs for Azure products with the pricing calculator . Get help with your bill through Azure support . Account information Subscription ID: e23aea56-f82c-4242-a329-987c1db19587 This email was sent from an unmonitored inbox. body.content: Explore technical support plans to find the one that meets your needs. View as a webpage Find the Azure support expert you need Whether youre just starting with Azure or already deploying business-critical workloads, Azure support plans connect you with the right expertise for your situation. Choose the plan that meets your needs. Compare plans Developer For individuals looking to quickly get started on Azure. Technical support is available during business hours with initial response times under eight business hours. Standard For teams running production applications, get 24x7 technical support with initial response times under one hour. Professional Direct For business-critical applications, your designated Azure expert provides guidance to help you build resilient and cost-effective solutions. In addition, 24x7 technical support with initial response times under one hour is included. Learn more with the Azure support FAQs or contact support with questions.
